p: Rhizomorphs of Armillaria spp. play a pivotal role in infecting healthy plants and ultimately spread the disease. Root collar excavation followed by Trichoderma inoculation appears to offer a promising integrated strategy for the management of A. mellea [ 18, 281, 315]. The method alone is unlikely to eradicate an Armillaria infection, but in the case of grapevine, it may allow an infected plant to tolerate Armillaria root rot [ 315].
